nodes.text: Something I‚Äôve learnt covering care is how many carers have been in a dilemma: some have mild symptoms but can‚Äôt afford the time off on SSR if a test is +. So some have been reluctant to get tests. Idea of compulsion/fjnes might well extend that disincentive to the rest of us.
nodes.author: Lewis Goodall

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Yup. Numbers of tests go down... but so does our ability to trace the virus. Boom.
nodes.author: Tom Bacon

nodes.text: @luisafontana @lewis_goodall What if they have children/family members who rely on them & with reduced income they wont be able to put food on the table/pay bills?
nodes.author: gwen_m üíö

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall When did the Tories ever govern by encouraging collective spirit instead of pitting different parts of society against one another?
nodes.author: LI

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Too bloody right. Perhaps another symptom of the 'Westminster Snitch Bubble', along with assuming we wouldn't obey the lock down rules because just like them we don't care about each other. Wrong on both counts. They should all get out more (esp of office).

The fines are a disincentive to get a test rather and give to false impression the govt have managed this crisis.  It's also a dead cat.
nodes.author: Jock McTavish #Cummings to get you

@LukeBrighto74 @lewis_goodall To be honest they are probably right. Rhinovirus is exploding at the moment. My kids have it and so I do. 

School being v. sensible about it. Had them off for a day or two and then back.

Result: fresh outbreak.

nodes.author: keith seymour

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Put this scenario to them then see what they say?
nodes.author: Jeremy

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Johnson has caught up to the fact that increased public solidarity in the first phase undermined core Tory message of selfishness & has increased support for NHS, making it harder to privatize (so it is happening offscreen by stealth & private contracts).
nodes.author: Alan Horrox

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall I can only assume it's deliberate - eases pressure on testing (Govt win) and sets up the possibility of blaming people rather than policy (another win, and a line they're pushing hard today). https://t.co/RJSlD0OwRq
nodes.author: David Ward

nodes.text: @luisafontana @lewis_goodall You realise you're typing this on the same day the eviction ban is ending, right? They could now very easily end up on the streets That's one of a myriad of choices people are being forced to make by not having a safety net, see also eating.
nodes.author: Nightcrawler Explainer

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall This government has always prioritised things other than saving lives despite its proven efficacy (look at how countries which did prioritise lives have done compared to UK).

Here they're prioritising laying blame on others.
nodes.author: markhughes

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall despite everything, the Conservatives & the people at the top of care companies, & their lobbyists, & their investors, believe care workers are disposable scum 

it's a shame low expectations are so entrenched - with organisation & brave leadership they could be so powerful

@C19Watchdog @tattie_j @lewis_goodall Probably because they are expected to meet a lot of people but will be using appropriate masks etc therefore minimum risk. If they used the app entire police force would be isolating.
nodes.author: Angus Sawyer

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall ¬£500 payment from 28th September is supposedly not just for those on benefits
nodes.author: PB Politics

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall I am a carer, for my mother, 94. Both of us at risk and 'shielding' I have on average 7 different carers come in every week, plus docs, nurses etc. If I get sick I have no idea what will happen to that care. Could you highlight this general situation too please?
nodes.author: martin

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Think of that from the govt POV. The less people who have tests, the less Covid there is, as Trump helpfully explained.  Much like the phony "decrease" in death rates that the govt pulled off without a significant backlash. Excess deaths of 60-70k magically fell to 40k overnight.
nodes.author: Alan Horrox

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall I think the best they could do is an 'isolation payment' for everyone with a positive test. Problem as soon as people can't get a test then the system becomes unfair.
nodes.author: Jason Kelley

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Over thinking it. Some will do the right thing regardless. Some will not. Some will need fear of a fine and for some nothing will make them do the right  thing.
nodes.author: Jason Kelley

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall It's all part of the same dark Schtick.
Bottom line,they are overwhelmed by their own incompetence and can do no better than to present the public with "The Solution Du jour"
nodes.author: Alexandra Keith

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall You can predict this. Most of us can expect this is likely. Just don't expect @didoharding or @MattHancock to see it coming?
nodes.author: HELEN STATHAM

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall As a Civil Servant I had to take time off due to pneumonia. At my return to work interview my manager asked if I could have got out of bed to claim a ¬£20 bonus in the office. It didn't end well.

nodes.text: @luisafontana @lewis_goodall And the fact that they themselves or a family they support might die if there is no income coming in for two weeks?

@lewis_goodall It has nothing to do with controlling the Virus, It has everything to do with new Govt strategy to blame the public and take no blame themselves.
They are running out of civil servants to sack, They are responsible for nothing but mixed messaging and Failure, Johnson must go,,
nodes.author: Ed Barrett

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Particularly taken alongside Hancock‚Äôs instruction that people without symptoms shouldn‚Äôt get a test. It‚Äôs not difficult to imagine people with mild symptoms feeling justified in not seeking a test.
nodes.author: Alex Walters

nodes.text: @jami0mckay @lewis_goodall Or even ¬£1k... Even those on modest incomes may struggle if they don't have savings .. would home owners be forced to sell to pay up?.. Not saying it's ok to not self isolate when +..but just thinking out loud here on how they will enforce the fines
nodes.author: Faye

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall If carers have mild symptoms but can't afford the time off if they get a positive test so stay at work .
 It just shows what an utter disgrace and farce  it is that the residents are exiled  from their own families who have NO symptoms.
nodes.author: I am Peter

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall You seem to make the assumption that policies are being made with the aim of tackling the pandemic. I rather think the aim of the policy is to put into the public mind that blame for Covid being out of control is with disobedient members of the public not govt.
Or am I cynical?
nodes.author: Carl Abbott

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Exactly. Most people are trying to be as responsible as possible and threatening them with fines doesn‚Äôt help anyone. They are more likely to try to ignore the symptoms/hide them rather than get tested.
nodes.author: Liz Jarvis

nodes.text: @luisafontana @lewis_goodall You really have no idea at all

nodes.author: Dave (a.k.a. Mr Roast)

@lewis_goodall
And if need to claim universal credit then would wait 5 weeks for payment unless took repayable advance, putting them in debt

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall What about 83 residents of 2 state of the art #dementia Care home being evicted. Care provider can't make money out of sites & a Council would rather close them than keep them open in a #Covid19UK #pandemic . Ask @LynStaunton & @jodierose1988 for more info. National Scandal !
nodes.author: Stephen McNally

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall I know doctors who will not download the app. If they don‚Äôt know they have been in close contact they can‚Äôt be forced to isolate.
nodes.author: TattieJ

nodes.text: One way you could see that playing out: govt advertises a fine , a person with mild symptoms worries they‚Äôll come back + because they can‚Äôt afford to be off work, doesn‚Äôt want to run risk of a fine, doesn‚Äôt get a test. Track and trace never gets to them, contacts never traced.
nodes.author: Lewis Goodall

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall It's even worse for unpaid carers. 2x SEND children (I am carer) + 2x medically vulnerable here, 1 MV is also a child & council registered young carer. 3 different schools. No apparent contingency planning for if 1 of us becomes ill with Covid... Who then looks after the others?
nodes.author: Jozinhagirl (Activist Lawyer)

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall so govt could at least increase SSP to prevent people being put in this impossible position whilst ill but key workers in a pandemic
nodes.author: Tessa

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall If Boris is struggling on 150 pa plus perks how can you live on ¬£73 pw sick pay
nodes.author: Dene dickerson

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall trade unions have been calling for sick pay to be increased since start of pandemic - GMB surveyed their care workers on this and 81% responded that they‚Äôd be forced to continue going into work if ill as they can‚Äôt afford to live on SSP
nodes.author: Tessa

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall If the govt could simply pay equal wages for those who need to self-isolate people would. The govt are out of touch thinking people can *do the right thing* and stay home when they also need to feed their family & pay bills
nodes.author: Emmselk üá™üá∫ #UnitedInDiversity

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall In the other hand if they give their customers Covid they‚Äôll be dead and they‚Äôll be out of a job permanently..
nodes.author: alert daz

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Tory‚Äôs won‚Äôt get that.  For then it‚Äôs all about looking after number 1 and self advancement.  Of course, they see snitching as a better way than working together / solidarity
nodes.author: Silent Majority

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall ‚Äúsolidarity and togetherness‚Äù were destroyed by Cummings, but he could have been an object lesson in snitching with no punishment‚Ä¶
nodes.author: Scott

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Behaviourally punishment never works.
nodes.author: Cerulean Man üá™üá∫ üè≥Ô∏è‚Äçüåà

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall Exactly. Fewer symptomatic people will get tested, and nobody will answer the phone to Test & Trace.

It's a disastrous policy, unless all you're hoping to achieve is reduced pressure on collapsing Test & Trace system and less alarming case numbers...
nodes.author: Ride4Truth

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall https://t.co/IREl6B4IlS
nodes.author: Ian Vincent Scott

nodes.text:
@lewis_goodall Yes well duh. Its obviously a scheme designed to lower teat numbers for a few pretty obvious reasons.

And that means that the coronavirus will spread unchecked in the UK.
nodes.author: „Åù„ÅÆÁî∑„ÄÅÂá∂Êö¥„Å´„Å§„Åç

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Excellent point. Consider also how narrow the defining symptoms of CV19 are from the govt for which a Carer is entitled to a test. Surely you want to consider every possible symptom, as defined by WHO? How many carers refused tests despite having symptoms not on govt list?
nodes.author: Laurie Driver - Low Skilled (Key)Worker üî∂

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall On the face of it, it would appear a terrible policy.
nodes.author: Megasaur!

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Concerning testing
nodes.author: Ian Vincent Scott

nodes.text: More broadly speaking, I‚Äôve spoken to lots of behavioural experts in recent weeks and months and they‚Äôve pretty much all been concerned with the move to ‚Äúsnitching‚Äù/punishment over emphasising solidarity and togetherness. Many think emphasising former is counter productive.
nodes.author: Lewis Goodall

nodes.text: As I‚Äôve reported throughout, without proper sick pay the carers are put in an invidious position. Clearly that will be the case for many other sectors and employees on low pay. Government has announced help for those on benefits but plenty of those on low pay aren‚Äôt on benefits.
nodes.author: Lewis Goodall

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall So there will be enough tests to go round after all, for all those that want them, but not those that need them.
nodes.author: Sharon Gascoigne

nodes.text: @lewis_goodall Send Crispin Odey and his friends the bill.
nodes.author: EmmersonLickspittle
